concept.title: Customer journeys
concept.shortdesc: In , a customer journey is a passage or progression through a path, or number of paths, to reach a goal, such as a product purchase.

conbody.p: The journey can include a number of paths, which are routes or courses that the customer takes to reach a particular goal or objective. The customer can use multiple channels, such as Web, email, social networks, or mobile applications, in a single path.
The following example shows a path that customers followed to reach the goal of a product purchase. The path shows the channels that customers used to interact with the brand to reach the goal.

fig.title: Multi-channel path that ends in a product purchase

conbody.p: provides path analysis tools to help you examine the paths that are the most relevant to your organizational goals. For example, you can submit a request for a report of the paths that your top-tier buyers traveled after they watched a video on your website, or the paths that they traveled that led to the purchase of a product.
